Instruction: Combine crust ingredients: In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press mixture into the bottom of a 9-inch pie dish.
Bake crust: Bake for 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Let cool completely.
Juice the limes: Juice the key limes and strain to remove seeds.
Combine filling ingredients: In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolks, sweetened condensed milk, lime juice, and lime zest.
Pour into crust: Pour filling into prepared pie crust.
Bake: Bake in preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the filling is set around the edges but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Cool completely: Let the pie cool completely on a wire rack before adding the meringue.
Beat egg whites: In a clean bowl, beat egg whites with cream of tartar until soft peaks form.
Gradually add sugar: Gradually add sugar, beating until stiff peaks form.
Top with meringue: Spread meringue over the cooled pie filling.
Torch meringue (optional): Lightly brown the meringue with a kitchen torch (optional).
Refrigerate: Refrigerate the pie for at least 2 hours before serving.
